primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The transformation of the human heart from greed/self-centeredness to radical generosity through the contemplation of Christ's 'economic' sacrifice.

tekstueel_bewijs: You can work on your heart.
Bring the gospel into that part of your life and think about what he did for you until it makes you weep.

object.identificatie: A Generous Heart / The Harvest of Righteousness
tekstueel_bewijs: You are reaping a harvest of righteousness.
For you know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ

ontvanger.identificatie: The World / The Poor / The Hearer
tekstueel_bewijs: so that you through his poverty might become rich.
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: Does hearer identify with Subject or Receiver?

helper.identificatie: The Vision of the Savior / The Gospel Logic
tekstueel_bewijs: You also get a vision of the Savior himself.
He’s affecting your heart attitude toward money by bringing the gospel into the economic world.
helper.rol_van_god: Is God Subject, Helper, or absent?

tekstueel_bewijs: Greed is the opposite of generosity.
If you store up too much for yourself, it’ll rot your soul. There will be maggots.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is primarily an internal disposition (greed) rather than an external cosmic power like Sin or Death.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Incarnation: God giving the Son to humanity.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: God the Father / Jesus Christ
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (God's action) provides the 'fuel' or 'competence' for the primary program (the hearer's change).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Vision of Christ → The Hearer ← Greed/Hoarding

voorbeelden_god_subject: God became a baby at Christmas.
He was rejected by the Father so you could have the only riches.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: You can work on your heart.
You need to start to learn to look at all the money you have earned... as a gift.

voorbeelden: You must not take more than your family needed.
I want you to want to do it.
Unless you’re giving joyfully, eagerly... you actually don’t have a heart of generosity.
Think about what he did for you.
You don’t have to be passive about it.
Let it melt you into becoming more like him.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on 'Recruitment'—awakening the desire (Vouloir) to be generous by using the Gospel as a motivational tool.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from ~S1 (Legalism/Pharisees) to S2 (The rot of greed) to S1 (The grace of Christ).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by 'melting' the heart through the contemplation of Christ's poverty.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. Greed is described as soul-rotting (maggots/worms).

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon uses strong grace-language and makes Christ the ultimate giver, the 'engine' of the sermon is the hearer's work on their own heart. God is the Helper/Model, while the Hearer is the Subject of the change.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: You can work on your heart. There are things you can do.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He was even rejected by the Father so you could have the only riches that will last forever.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Macedonians and Christ are used as models for the hearer to emulate.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Focus on the Holy Spirit as the one who produces the fruit of generosity, rather than the hearer 'working on their heart'.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Empowerment mixed with introspection; potential for new legalism (the 'joy' requirement).
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Sanctification is viewed as a conscious cognitive application of the Gospel to the self.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon is highly coherent, linking the Old Testament manna, the Corinthian situation, and the Gospel into a single narrative of 'economic' grace.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'I am not commanding you' and the heavy moral weight of 'if you don't have a generous heart... it'll rot your soul'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He became poor, so that you through his poverty might become rich.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon relies on 'Savoir-faire' (knowing the gospel) to create 'Vouloir-faire' (willingness), bypassing the Spirit's 'Pouvoir-faire'.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Serious internal rot, but treatable through 'thinking' and 'looking'.

eschatologie.actant_van_voltooiing: God (New Heavens) and Man (Healing the world through giving)

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully avoids legalism (Devoir) but falls into a 'Gospel-driven moralism' where the Hearer is the Subject of sanctification and Christ is the Helper/Model.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is told to 'work on their heart' (Hearer = Subject).
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: The Holy Spirit/Grace is the Subject who changes the heart.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'You can work on your heart,' use 'The Spirit uses the vision of Christ to melt your heart.'

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer as the one who must produce 'joy' to be acceptable.
identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Hearer as the 'Receiver' of a new heart.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize that even the 'willingness' is a gift from the Sender.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Mention the Holy Spirit's role in producing the fruit of the Spirit (generosity).

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The sermon already takes the danger of greed seriously.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: The hierarchy of Soteriology → Ethics is well-maintained.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of 'Gospel-centered' preaching that nonetheless places a high burden on the hearer's internal psychological work.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'maggot' metaphor; Greimas shows that the metaphor functions as an 'Opponent' to the Subject's progress.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the tithe in Luke 11; Greimas shows that the Pharisee is a 'Negative Subject' who lacks the correct 'Object' (Love).
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that despite the 'grace' vocabulary, the hearer is still the primary 'Subject' of the action, making it anthropocentric at the deep structural level.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses 'grace' as a tool for the hearer rather than an agent that acts upon the hearer.
